snippet: Quantum information theory could well usher in a radical new era of technology, one that makes today’s fastest computers look like hand-cranked adding machines.
abstract: Quantum information theory could well usher in a radical new era of technology, one that makes today’s fastest computers look like hand-cranked adding machines.
lead_paragraph: Quantum information theory could well usher in a radical new era of technology, one that makes today’s fastest computers look like hand-cranked adding machines, writes Adam Frank, a professor of physics and astronomy at the University of Rochester, in an Opinion Page article. Read more »
